Richard Metcalfe (ext. 306) Catering Manager
The dining area is modern, bright, light and vibrant. The catering facilities also encompass the College Bar (HQ.) and a one-stop shop in the dining room.

The system that is in use in the dining facilities makes use of the college ID card. This card will be issued to you on arrival, and will be pre-loaded with credit. Resident students who are living in part catered halls will have £360 loaded onto their ID card. This equates to 12 weeks x £30. This allowance is for the 1st term only, the allowance for the 2nd & 3rd terms will be loaded onto the cards in January. Lost ID cards must be reported as soon as possible, either to one of the dining room supervisors or to the ID access administrator, Karl Baxter (ext. 194). If your allowance of £30 per week runs out before the end of term, you can top-up your account by cash, cheque or credit card .Resident students should be aware that the £30 is not intended to cover all their catering costs, but is a maximum contribution towards it.

If you use up your allowance for the term you may either purchase meals as a cash transaction or top-up your card by making a payment. Unused allowances can be transferred into the next term within the accommodation contract dates. However unused allowances cannot be refunded at the end of the accommodation contract. Swipe card accounts are available to students who are in self-catering rooms, by simply contacting the catering office. Swipe cards can be used in the bar, but only for the purchase of food, soft drinks and confectionery.
